column3: Lawmaker: Britain must question Gen. Pinochet about killings
column4: LONDON (AP) _ An influential lawmaker from the governing LaborParty on Saturday backed Spanish requests to question formerChilean dictator Gen. Augusto Pinochet in London for back surgeryon allegations of genocide and terrorism.

column3: British police arrest Pinochet on murder charges
column4: LONDON (AP) _ Eight years after his turbulent regime endedformer Chilean strongman Gen. Augusto Pinochet is being called toaccount by Spanish authorities for the deaths detention andtorture of political opponents.

column3: British police arrest Pinochet on Spanish warrant
column4: LONDON (AP) _ Former Chilean dictator Gen. Augusto Pinochet hasbeen arrested by British police on a Spanish extradition warrantdespite protests from Chile that he is entitled to diplomaticimmunity.

column3: Castro disagrees with arrest of Pinochet
column4: OPORTO Portugal (AP) _ President Fidel Castro said Sunday hedisagreed with the arrest in London of former Chilean dictatorAugusto Pinochet calling it a case of ``international meddling.''

column3: Germany reports terrorist threat against U.S. embassy
column4: BONN Germany (AP) _ German police raided several locations nearBonn after receiving word of a terrorist threat against the U.S.Embassy but no evidence of a planned attack was found officialssaid Wednesday.

column3: Bin Laden `hero' to some who warn U.S. against his capture
column4: ISLAMABAD Pakistan (AP) _ An Islamic militant group on Thursdaythreatened to retaliate if Saudi dissident Osama bin Laden isarrested and described Washington's No. 1 enemy as a ``hero'' toMuslims worldwide.
